messages.content: Save-image-extended-comfyui is a custom node for ComfyUI that allows saving images in various formats like JXL, AVIF, WebP, JPEG, JPEG2k, and customizing the folder, sub-folders, and filenames of the images.
What are some of the supported file extensions by save-image-extended-comfyui?
Some of the supported file extensions by save-image-extended-comfyui include JXL, AVIF, WebP, jpg, jpeg, j2k, jp2, png, gif, tiff, and bmp.
How does save-image-extended-comfyui handle unknown key names in filename_keys and foldername_keys?

Save-image-extended-comfyui treats unknown key names in filename_keys and foldername_keys as custom strings. For example, if you enter 'wrongNumber.attribute', you will get 'attribute' in your filename.
What is the purpose of the counter_digits parameter in save-image-extended-comfyui?
The counter_digits parameter in save-image-extended-comfyui determines the number of digits used for the image counter. For example, setting it to '3' will result in filenames like 'image_001.png'.
How does save-image-extended-comfyui handle datetime formats in file and folder names?
Save-image-extended-comfyui can convert unix datetime formats in file and folder names. For example, '%F' or '%Y-%m-%d' will result in a date format like '2024-05-22'.
What is the purpose of the save_metadata parameter in save-image-extended-comfyui?
The save_metadata parameter in save-image-extended-comfyui, when enabled, saves metadata into the generated image file.
What are the optional node inputs for save-image-extended-comfyui?
The optional node inputs for save-image-extended-comfyui are 'positive_text_opt' and 'negative_text_opt', which can be used when utilizing custom nodes for positive and negative prompt text.
